intro: Viguiera pohliana, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its foliage is gray-green with hairy surfaces, and it produces pink to purple flowers in late summer. Viguiera pohliana is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
